en.av_c1: Let's see how to find the closed form solution for $\displaystyle\sum_{i=1}^{n}i$.
en.av_c3.1: When $i=1$, this adds $1$ to the summation. Represent this by a single rectangle.
en.av_c4.1: When $i = 2$, this adds $2$ to the overall summation. Represent this by two rectangles.
en.av_c5.1: When $i = 3$, this adds $3$ to the summation. Represent this by three rectangles.
en.av_c6.1: When $i = 4$, this adds $4$ to the summation. Represent this by four rectangles.
en.av_c7.1: When $i = 5$, this adds $4$ to the summation. Represent this by five rectangles.
en.av_c8: The closed form solution for this summation can be found by calculating the area of the resulting shape.
en.av_c9: The area will be the area of the big triangle
en.av_c10: $\ +$ the sum of the areas of the $n$ small rectangles.
